newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil raises 60 mln reais with Coelba share sale.
newsitem.headline: Brazil raises 60 mln reais with Coelba share sale.

text.p: Brazil raised 60.02 million reais with the sale of 702 million common shares of Bahia state power utility Coelba Wednesday, the Rio de Janeiro Stock Exchange said.

A total of 670 million shares, representing a 6.88 percent voting stake in Coelba, belonged to Brazil's BNDES Participacoes (BNDESPar), the investment arm of the National Development Bank (BNDES), while the remainder was offered by other investors, the bolsa said.

Coelba shares were sold for 85.50 reais per lot of 1,000 shares, 3.23 percent over the 82.82 reais base price, it added. Controlled by Bahia state government, Coelba is expected to be privatized this year.
